doc.previous: However towards the end of the 19th century the economy began declining and by the 1940s Malta s economy was in serious crisis One factor was the longer range of newer merchant ships that required less frequent refuelling stops
doc.after: Currently Malta s major resources are limestone a favourable geographic location and a productive labour force Malta produces only about 20 of its food needs has limited freshwater supplies because of the drought in the summer and has no domestic energy sources aside from the potential for solar energy from its plentiful sunlight 106 The economy is dependent on foreign trade serving as a freight trans shipment point manufacturing especially electronics and textiles and tourism
